document_data.caption: A variety of aventurine stones.
document_data.name: Aventurine
document_data.mainbody: '''Aventurine''', also known as a '''love stone''',<ref group="note">The original article in ''[[Dragon magazine 72|Dragon #72]]'' states that the nickname "love stone" is unknown in the Realms, but every publication since then has given aventurine this nickname. was usually discovered in large deposits—blocks up to 20 lb (9.1 kg) were not unusual.
document_data.Description: This [[Semi-precious stones|semi-precious stone]] was a variety of [[wikipedia:en:quartz|quartz]] that glittered when viewed from certain angles due to [[mica]] inclusions. It could be found in shades of green from medium to light, blues from dark to pale, or a warm gold. [[wikipedia:facet|Faceting]] only detracted from the flash below the surface of this translucent stone, so it was tumbled smooth, cut [[wikipedia:cabochon|cabochon]], or used as an inlay or in carvings. A typical stone had a base value of 50 gp.
document_data.Powers: Crushed to a powder and sprinkled, thrown or blown, aventurine could dispel on contact most [[illusion]]s and transformations, such as those used for disguise.
document_data.Rumors and Legends: * [[Rashemi]] witches were said to seek out aventurine stones to cast invocations, evocations and perform spirit work.
